channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-6083] Modify old filter tests to use Junit4/no longer use HBaseTestCase
item.summary: Modify old filter tests to use Junit4/no longer use HBaseTestCase

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
review board entry is here(I had assumed it would get linked automatically)

https://reviews.apache.org/r/5220/

Here is what I put up in rb in case it doesn't make it over here:

Looks great. Please attach to the issue so can commit. I think rb did not update the issue because jira was down for a good while (I think that the cause – it looks like you set the right fields in rb).
Patch, as was put up to review board

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12530134/hbase-6083.txt
against trunk revision .

-1 @author. The patch appears to contain 1 @author tags which the Hadoop community has agreed to not allow in code contributions.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 33 new or modified tests.

-1 patch. The patch command could not apply the patch.

Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2043//console

This message is automatically generated.
Make Juhani's patch apply to trunk (trunk was mvn modularized since patch was made)

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12530150/6083v2.txt
against trunk revision .

-1 @author. The patch appears to contain 1 @author tags which the Hadoop community has agreed to not allow in code contributions.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 33 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

-1 core tests. The patch failed these unit tests:
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.TestFromClientSide

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2046//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2046//console

This message is automatically generated.
Fail seems unrelated but retrying just in case.

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12530156/6083v2.txt
against trunk revision .

-1 @author. The patch appears to contain 1 @author tags which the Hadoop community has agreed to not allow in code contributions.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 33 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

-1 findbugs. The patch appears to cause Findbugs (version 1.3.9) to fail.

+1 release audit. The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2048//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/2048//console

This message is automatically generated.
Committed to trunk. Thanks for the patch Juhani.
Added you as a contributor Juhani. Assigned you this issue.

Integrated in HBase-TRUNK #2952 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/HBase-TRUNK/2952/)
HBASE-6083 Modify old filter tests to use Junit4/no longer use HBaseTestCase (Revision 1344111)

Result = SUCCESS
